page.title: 20THE MARKET HALL, WIGAN
page.content: { Wigan Market Hall}is one the last parts of{'Victorian Wigan'}still in regular use. The late 19th century covered hall houses over 100 separate stalls and is the scene of hectic activity six days a week. However, as with many old buildings it is in need of urgent repairs. The local council has decided that it would be more economical to{demolish}it and{replace it with a modern version. Many people have written to the local paper (The Wigan Observer) complaining about this decision saying that the money would be better spent on the restoration of the original site. This question was posed to 100 people { "Is a new market hall necessary?" and the results were:- YES NO DON'T KNOW 28% 46% 26% showing that a new hall is not needed.
